page.title: 06Wytham, the local directory
page.content: The parish of Wytham covers 806 hectares. The population of Wytham is 152 people. The local directory gave us an idea of where they lived. There is consecutive numbering of cottages from 6-30. Then the buildings can be identified individually. Some names tell us who lived there at some time:Gardener's Cottage, Keeper's Cottage, Old School, School House, the Post Office, Wytham Abbey, the Dower House and the Rectory. Some names tell us what could be found at that place: Old Laundry Cottage, Orchard Cottage, the Bothy, Garage Cottages, White Hart Inn and the Glebe. The last group show how rural the area is: Home, Linch, Northfield, Overfofd and Wytham Mill Farms,with the modern additions of the Laboratory and the Field Station. One cottage called "Hornbeams" completes the entries in the directory (1985).
